00038 DmListener::DmCall::DmCall()
00039 {
00040   good = false;
00041   call = affx::NN; // unknown
00042   conf = 0;
00043 }
00044 
00045 /**
00046  * Constructor takes a vector of ProbeSets for which calls will be
00047  * done as cel files become available.
00048  *
00049  * @param psVec - Vector of probesets to be calculated.  @param
00050  * hetMult - Factor to add to log likelihood to balance het/hom calls
00051  * 0 for no effect.
00052  *
00053  * @return
00054  */
00055 
00056 
00057 DmListener::DmListener(std::vector<ProbeListPacked> &probesets, float hetMult,
00058                        int maxChips, std::vector<float> &thresholds,
00059                        std::map<string, bool> &chrXSnps, std::string callRateName)
00060 {
00061   std::vector<ProbeSet *>::iterator iter;
00062   Err::check(!thresholds.empty(), "DmListener::DmListener() - Can't supply no thresholds.");
00063   m_HetMultiplier = hetMult;
00064   m_ChipCount = 0;
00065   m_MaxChips = maxChips;
00066   m_Thresholds = thresholds;
00067   m_TotalCalls.resize(m_MaxChips);
00068   m_PassCalls.resize(m_Thresholds.size());
00069   m_HetChrXCalls.resize(m_Thresholds.size());
00070   m_FirstPassGender.resize(maxChips, affx::UnknownGender);
00071   m_FirstPassHetRate.resize(maxChips, 0.0);
00072   m_ChrXCalls.resize(maxChips);
00073   m_ChrXSnps = chrXSnps;
00074   m_CallIndex = 0;
00075   m_ChrXCallIndex = 0;
00076   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < m_PassCalls.size(); i++) {
00077     m_PassCalls[i].resize(m_MaxChips);
00078     m_HetChrXCalls[i].resize(m_MaxChips);
00079   }
00080   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < probesets.size(); i++) {
00081     m_PlVec.push_back(probesets[i]);
00082   }
00083 
00084   m_KeepGenotypes = true;
00085 
00086 
00087   m_GenderName = "dm-chrX-het-rate";
00088   m_GenderDescription = "DM chrX het rate";
00089   setPrefix("dm-listener");
00090 
00091   if (callRateName != "")
00092     setCallRateName(callRateName);
00093 
00094   if (m_ChrXSnps.size() > 0) {
00095     declareMetric(m_GenderName + "_gender", ChipSummary::Metric::String);
00096     declareMetric(m_GenderName + "_gender_chrX_het_rate", ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00097   }
00098   declareMetric(m_CallRateName, ChipSummary::Metric::Double);
00099 }

00103 }

00106 /**
00107  * Clear genotype results. Gender results are retained.
00108  * Call rates (total and chrX) are retained and accumulated
00109  * over calls to this. The only thing this does is it
00110  * drops the genotype calls.
00111  * This allows us to save memory by not keeping around
00112  * genotypes that are no longer needed.
00113  */
00114 
00115 void DmListener::clearForIteration()
00116 {
00117   m_KnownCalls.clear();
00118   m_ChipCount = 0;
00119 }

00122  * Do we need to keep genotypes around for providing
00123  * seed calls? Default yes. If set to no, then
00124  * getGenoCalls will fail if called.
00125  * @param s - true or false
00126  */
00127 void DmListener::setKeepGenotypes(bool s)
00128 {
00129   m_KeepGenotypes = s;
00130 }

00133 void DmListener::setLayout(ChipLayout &layout)
00134 {
00135   m_PlVec.clear();
00136   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < layout.getProbeSetCount(); i++) {
00137     m_PlVec.push_back(layout.getProbeListAtIndex(i));
00138   }
00139 }

00141 /**
00142  * @brief Check if a call exists for a given probeset name
00143  * @param name - name of probeset to get genotype calls for.
00144  * @return boolean result
00145  */
00146 bool DmListener::checkGenoCallsName(const std::string &name)
00147 {
00148   return m_KnownCalls.end() != m_KnownCalls.find(name);
00149 }

00151 /** Accessor function. */
00152 int DmListener::getChipCount()
00153 {
00154   return m_ChipCount;

00156 
00157 /**
00158  * Get the call rate at a particular threshold. Note that we can keep
00159  * track of the rate at multiple thresholds, but only keep the actual
00160  * calls for a particular threshold due to space (RAM) concerns.
00161  *
00162  * @param callRates - Vector to be filled in with call rates, one for each chip.
00163  * @param thresholdIndex - Which threshold to use (as defined in constructor).
00164  */
00165 void DmListener::getCallRates(std::vector<float> &callRates, int thresholdIndex)
00166 {
00167   callRates.clear();
00168   callRates.resize(m_ChipCount);
00169   assert(thresholdIndex < m_PassCalls.size());
00170   assert(m_PassCalls[thresholdIndex].size() == m_ChipCount);
00171   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < m_ChipCount; i++) {
00172     assert(m_TotalCalls[i] > 0);
00173     callRates[i] = (float)m_PassCalls[thresholdIndex][i] / m_TotalCalls[i];
00174   }
00175 }
00176 
00177 /**
00178  * Get the call rate for a specific chip
00179  * @param chip - the chip index to pull
00180  * @param thresholdIndx - which threshold should be applied
00181  * @return The call rate for that chip
00182  */
00183 float DmListener::getCallRate(int chip, int thresholdIndex)
00184 {
00185   if (m_TotalCalls[chip] == 0) {
00186     return -1;
00187   } else {
00188     //Verbose::out(1,"Chip " + ToStr(chip) + " has " + ToStr(m_PassCalls[thresholdIndex][chip]) + " passing calls out of " + ToStr(m_TotalCalls[chip]));
00189     return (float)m_PassCalls[thresholdIndex][chip] / m_TotalCalls[chip];
00190   }
00191 }
00192 
00193 
00194 /**
00195  * Get the call rates for chrX snps at a particular threshold. Note that we
00196  * can keep track of the rate at multiple thresholds, but only keep the actual
00197  * calls for a particular threshold due to space (RAM) concerns.
00198  *
00199  * @param callRates - Vector to be filled in with call rates for chrx snps,
00200  *                    one for each chip.
00201  * @param thresholdIndex - Which threshold to use (as defined in constructor.
00202  */
00203 void DmListener::getHetChrXRates(std::vector<float> &hetRates, int thresholdIndex)
00204 {
00205   hetRates.clear();
00206   hetRates.resize(m_ChipCount);
00207   assert(thresholdIndex < m_HetChrXCalls.size());
00208   assert(m_HetChrXCalls[thresholdIndex].size() == m_ChipCount);
00209   for (uint32_t i = 0; i < m_ChipCount; i++) {
00210     if (m_ChrXCalls[i] == 0) {
00211       hetRates[i] = -1;
00212     } else {
00213       hetRates[i] = (float)m_HetChrXCalls[thresholdIndex][i] / m_ChrXCalls[i];
00214     }
00215   }
00216 }
00217 
00218 /**
00219  * Get the chrX het rate for a specific chip
00220  * @param chip - the chip index to pull
00221  * @param thresholdIndex - which threshold should be applied
00222  * @return the chrX het rate for that chip
00223  */
00224 float DmListener::getHetChrXRate(int chip, int thresholdIndex)
00225 {
00226   if (m_ChrXCalls[chip] == 0) {
00227     return -1;
00228   } else {
00229     return (float)m_HetChrXCalls[thresholdIndex][chip] / m_ChrXCalls[chip];
00230   }
00231 }

00234 /**
00235  * Set the index (into the thresholds vector in constructor) that we will
00236  * use by default when queried for call rates.
00237  *
00238  * @param index - index into the call rates at different thresholds
00239  * we keep track of as defined by the thresholds vector in
00240  * constructor.
00241  */
00242 void DmListener::setDefaultCallIndex(int index)
00243 {
00244   if ((size_t)index >= m_PassCalls.size()) {
00245     Err::errAbort("DmListener::setDefaultCallIndex() - Can't set default to: " +
00246                   ToStr(index) + " when there are at most: " + ToStr(m_PassCalls.size()));
00247   }
00248   m_CallIndex = index;
00249 }
00250 
00251 /**
00252  * Set the index (into the thresholds vector in constructor) that we will
00253  * use by default when queried for call rates.
00254  *
00255  * @param index - index into the call rates at different thresholds
00256  * we keep track of as defined by the thresholds vector in
00257  * constructor.
00258  */
00259 void DmListener::setDefaultChrXCallIndex(int index)
00260 {
00261   if ((size_t)index >= m_HetChrXCalls.size()) {
00262     Err::errAbort("DmListener::setDefaultChrXCallIndex() - Can't set default to: " +
00263                   ToStr(index) + " when there are at most: " + ToStr(m_HetChrXCalls.size()));
00264   }
00265   m_ChrXCallIndex = index;
00266 }

00308 /**
00309  * Will this probeset work for DM? That is does it have MM probes and
00310  * matched quartets of probes on A and B allele?
00311  * @param ps - Probeset to check.
00312  * @return - true if ok for DM, false otherwise.
00313  */
00314 bool DmListener::okForDm(const ProbeSet *ps)
00315 {
00316   bool ok = true;
00317   if (ps->psType != ProbeSet::GenoType) {
00318     ok = false;
00319   } else if (ps->numGroups != 2 && ps->numGroups != 4) {
00320     ok = false;
00321   } else if (ps->atomsPerGroup.empty()) {
00322     Err::errAbort("DmListener::okForDm() - Can't have multiple groups, but atomsPerGroup be emtpy in probeset: '" + ToStr(ps->name) + "'");
00323     ok = false;
00324   } else if (!ps->hasMM()) {
00325     ok = false;
00326   } else {
00327     for (int psIx = 0; psIx < ps->numGroups - 1; psIx += 2) {
00328       if (ps->atomsPerGroup[psIx] != ps->atomsPerGroup[psIx+1])
00329         ok = false;
00330     }
00331   }
00332   return ok;
00333 }
00334 
00335 void DmListener::fillInQuartet(vector<CQuartet> &qVec, const ProbeSet *ps, affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData *cel)
00336 {
00337   assert(ps);
00338   if (!okForDm(ps))
00339     Err::errAbort("Probeset " + ToStr(ps->name) + " not suitable for DM.");
00340 
00341   /* Genotype probe sets can have either 2 or 4 groups, for each
00342      type the even (0,2) are A alleles and odd (1,3) are B allele.s */
00343   int atomIndex = 0;
00344   for (int psIx = 0; psIx < ps->numGroups - 1; psIx += 2) {
00345     Err::check(ps->atomsPerGroup[psIx] == ps->atomsPerGroup[psIx+1],
00346                "DmListener::makeCall() - Though groups were symmetrical.");
00347     int atomsPer = ps->atomsPerGroup[psIx];
00348     /* Each block will have atomsPer atoms in there. */
00349     for (int atomIx = 0; atomIx < atomsPer; atomIx++) {
00350       int aIndex = atomIx + (atomIndex);
00351       int bIndex = aIndex + atomsPer;
00352       Atom *A = ps->atoms[aIndex];
00353       Atom *B = ps->atoms[bIndex];
00354 
00355       // Fill in PM/MM pair
00356       if (ps->hasMM()) {
00357         int aPM = -1, aMM = -1;
00358         assert(A->probes.size() % 2 == 0);
00359         assert(B->probes.size() % 2 == 0);
00360         for (int probeIx = 0; probeIx + 1 < A->probes.size(); probeIx += 2) {
00361           CQuartet q;
00362           int first = probeIx;
00363           int next = probeIx + 1;
00364           /* this is a little akward, need to pull out the a & b allele info,
00365              but I don't think there is a hard and fast rule about the order
00366              of the pm and mm probes, so check both for both a & b. */
00367 
00368           /* A allele */
00369           if (Probe::isPm(*A->probes[first]) && Probe::isMm(*A->probes[next])) {
00370             aPM = first;
00371             aMM = next;
00372           } else if (Probe::isPm(*A->probes[next]) && Probe::isMm(*A->probes[first])) {
00373             aPM = next;
00374             aMM = first;
00375           } else {
00376             Err::errAbort("Need a pm and mm probe in probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name) + " atom: " + ToStr(atomIx));
00377           }
00378           q.SetIntensity(CQuartet::A_Allele, CQuartet::PM, cel->GetIntensity(A->probes[aPM]->id));
00379           q.SetIntensity(CQuartet::A_Allele, CQuartet::MM, cel->GetIntensity(A->probes[aMM]->id));
00380           double pm_stdev = cel->GetStdv(A->probes[aPM]->id);
00381           double mm_stdev = cel->GetStdv(A->probes[aMM]->id);
00382           
00383           q.SetVariance(CQuartet::A_Allele, CQuartet::PM, pm_stdev * pm_stdev);
00384           q.SetVariance(CQuartet::A_Allele, CQuartet::MM, mm_stdev * mm_stdev);
00385           q.SetPixels(CQuartet::A_Allele, CQuartet::PM, cel->GetPixels(A->probes[aPM]->id));
00386           q.SetPixels(CQuartet::A_Allele, CQuartet::MM, cel->GetPixels(A->probes[aMM]->id));
00387 
00388           /* B Allele */
00389           if (Probe::isPm(*B->probes[first]) && Probe::isMm(*B->probes[next])) {
00390             aPM = first;
00391             aMM = next;
00392           } else if (Probe::isPm(*B->probes[next]) && Probe::isMm(*B->probes[first])) {
00393             aPM = next;
00394             aMM = first;
00395           } else {
00396             Err::errAbort("Need a pm and mm probe in probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name) + " atom: " + ToStr(atomIx));
00397           }
00398           q.SetIntensity(CQuartet::B_Allele, CQuartet::PM, cel->GetIntensity(B->probes[aPM]->id));
00399           q.SetIntensity(CQuartet::B_Allele, CQuartet::MM, cel->GetIntensity(B->probes[aMM]->id));
00400           pm_stdev = cel->GetStdv(B->probes[aPM]->id);
00401           mm_stdev = cel->GetStdv(B->probes[aMM]->id);
00402           q.SetVariance(CQuartet::B_Allele, CQuartet::PM, pm_stdev * pm_stdev);
00403           q.SetVariance(CQuartet::B_Allele, CQuartet::MM, mm_stdev * mm_stdev);
00404           q.SetPixels(CQuartet::B_Allele, CQuartet::PM, cel->GetPixels(B->probes[aPM]->id));
00405           q.SetPixels(CQuartet::B_Allele, CQuartet::MM, cel->GetPixels(B->probes[aMM]->id));
00406           qVec.push_back(q);
00407         }
00408       } else {
00409         Err::errAbort("Need a pm and mm probe in probeset: " + ToStr(ps->name) + " atom: " + ToStr(atomIx));
00410       }
00411     } // for each atom
00412     atomIndex += (2 * atomsPer);
00413   } // for each group
00414 }
00415 
00416 /**
00417  * Make DM genotyping call on a particular probeset given the data in the
00418  * cel file.
00419  *
00420  * @param ps - probeset to do genotyping call.
00421  * @param cel - cel file to use for data.
00422  *
00423  * @return Genotype call and confidence.
00424  */
00425 DmListener::DmCall DmListener::makeCall(float hetMult, const ProbeSet *ps, affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData *cel)
00426 {
00427   assert(ps);
00428   // set up the result.
00429   DmCall result;
00430   result.call = NN; // -1; unknown
00431   result.conf = 0;
00432   // if this probeset isn't compatible with DM then return NN call.
00433   if (!okForDm(ps)) {
00434     return result;
00435   }
00436 
00437   vector<CQuartet> qVec;
00438   fillInQuartet(qVec, ps, cel);
00439 
00440   std::pair<float, int> call;
00441   // Here is the actual work.
00442   if (CallDM(qVec, call, hetMult)) {
00443     result.good = true;
00444     result.conf = call.first;
00445     result.call = GType_from_int(call.second);
00446   } else {
00447     Verbose::out(1, "Dm call for probeset: '" + ToStr(ps->name) + "' failed.");
00448   }
00449 
00450   // sanity check...
00451   // assert(result.call >= -1 && result.call <= 2);
00452   assert(GType_valid(result.call));
00453   if (result.conf < 0 || result.conf > 1) {
00454     Err::errAbort("DmListener::makeCall() - Expecting p-value between 0 and 1, got: " + ToStr(result.conf));
00455   }
00456   return result;
00457 }
00458 
00459 void DmListener::assignCall(std::string &name, DmListener::DmCall &call, std::vector<affx::GType> &genoCall)
00460 {
00461   // keep statistics for all call rates.
00462   // some SNPs we might see on multiple iterations (ie chrX snps)
00463   map<string, vector<bool> >::iterator mapIter;
00464 
00465   // Initialize SNP to not seen, if not in map
00466   mapIter = m_SeenSNPs.find(name);
00467   if (mapIter == m_SeenSNPs.end()) {
00468     m_SeenSNPs[name].resize(m_MaxChips, false);
00469   }
00470 
00471   // If not seen, the compute stats
00472   if (m_SeenSNPs[name][m_ChipCount] == false) {
00473     for (unsigned int threshIx = 0; threshIx < m_Thresholds.size(); threshIx++) {
00474       if (call.good && call.conf < m_Thresholds[threshIx]) {
00475         m_PassCalls[threshIx][m_ChipCount]++;
00476       }
00477     }
00478     if (call.good) {
00479       m_TotalCalls[m_ChipCount]++;
00480     }
00481     //Verbose::out(1,"Adding Call: " + ToStr(name) + ", " + ToStr(call.conf) + ", " + ToStr(call.good));
00482     if (m_ChrXSnps.find(name) != m_ChrXSnps.end()) {
00483       for (unsigned int threshIx = 0; threshIx < m_Thresholds.size(); threshIx++) {
00484         if (call.good && call.conf < m_Thresholds[threshIx] && call.call == AB) {
00485           m_HetChrXCalls[threshIx][m_ChipCount]++;
00486         }
00487       }
00488       m_ChrXCalls[m_ChipCount]++;
00489     }
00490     m_SeenSNPs[name][m_ChipCount] = true;
00491   }
00492 
00493   // use index 0 to make actual call, when DM fails we set to NN.
00494   if (!call.good || call.conf >= m_Thresholds[0]) {
00495     call.call = NN;
00496   }
00497   genoCall[m_ChipCount] = call.call;
00498 }
00499 
00500 /**
00501  * Process another cel files worth of data.
00502  *
00503  * @param cel - Filehandle to open cel file.
00504  */
00505 void DmListener::newChip(affymetrix_fusion_io::FusionCELData *cel)
00506 {
00507   for (unsigned int psIx = 0; psIx < m_PlVec.size(); psIx++) {
00508     ProbeSet *ps = ProbeListFactory::asProbeSet(m_PlVec[psIx]);
00509     std::map<string, std::vector<GType> >::iterator mapIter;
00510     DmCall call = makeCall(m_HetMultiplier, ps, cel);
00511 
00512     std::string name = ps->name;
00513     mapIter = m_KnownCalls.find(name);
00514     if (mapIter == m_KnownCalls.end()) {
00515       // First time seen.
00516       std::vector<GType> genoCall(m_MaxChips);
00517       assignCall(name, call, genoCall);
00518       if (m_KeepGenotypes)
00519         m_KnownCalls[name] = genoCall;
00520     } else {
00521       // More have been seen
00522       assignCall(name, call, mapIter->second);
00523     }
00524     delete ps;
00525   }
00526   if (m_ChipCount == 0) {
00527     // trim excess capacity.
00528     std::map<string, std::vector<affx::GType> > tmp(m_KnownCalls);
00529     m_KnownCalls.swap(tmp);
00530   }
00531 
00532   // track the gender info over multiple iterations
00533   if (m_ChipCount >= m_Seen.size())
00534     m_Seen.resize(m_ChipCount + 1, false);
00535   if (!m_Seen[m_ChipCount]) {
00536     std::vector<ChipSummary::Metric> metrics;
00537     m_SummaryStats.push_back(metrics);
00538     if (m_ChrXSnps.size() > 0) {
00539       m_SummaryStats[m_ChipCount].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(m_GenderName + "_gender",
00540                                             affx::getGenderString(getGender(m_ChipCount))));
00541       m_SummaryStats[m_ChipCount].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(m_GenderName + "_gender_chrX_het_rate",
00542                                             getHetChrXRate(m_ChipCount)));
00543       m_FirstPassGender[m_ChipCount] = getGender(m_ChipCount);
00544       m_FirstPassHetRate[m_ChipCount] = getHetChrXRate(m_ChipCount);
00545     }
00546     m_SummaryStats[m_ChipCount].push_back(ChipSummary::Metric(m_CallRateName,
00547                                           getCallRate(m_ChipCount)));
00548     m_Seen[m_ChipCount] = true;
00549   } else {
00550     // Update call rate
00551     bool found = false;
00552     for (int i = 0; i < m_SummaryStats[m_ChipCount].size(); i++) {
00553       if (m_SummaryStats[m_ChipCount][i].m_Name == m_CallRateName) {
00554         float callRate = getCallRate(m_ChipCount);
00555         m_SummaryStats[m_ChipCount][i].m_Double = callRate;
00556         //Verbose::out(1,"Call rate update on chip " + ToStr(m_ChipCount) + " to " + ToStr(callRate));
00557         found = true;
00558       }
00559     }
00560     if (!found) {
00561       Err::errAbort("Unable to update dm-listener call rate for chip " + ToStr(m_ChipCount));
00562     }
00563 
00564     // We expect no change in gender and chrX het rate -- ie all
00565     // the chrX snps must be seen on the first pass
00566     if (m_ChrXSnps.size() > 0) {
00567       if (fabs(m_FirstPassHetRate[m_ChipCount] - getHetChrXRate(m_ChipCount)) > 0.00001)
00568         Err::errAbort(ToStr("DmListener chrX het rate changed between iterations!") +
00569                       " It was " + ToStr(m_FirstPassHetRate[m_ChipCount]) +
00570                       " but is now " + ToStr(getHetChrXRate(m_ChipCount)));
00571       if (m_FirstPassGender[m_ChipCount] != getGender(m_ChipCount))
00572         Err::errAbort(ToStr("DmListener computed gender changed between iterations!") +
00573                       " It was " + affx::getGenderString(m_FirstPassGender[m_ChipCount]) +
00574                       " but is now " + affx::getGenderString(getGender(m_ChipCount)));
00575     }
00576   }
00577 
00578   setValid(true);
00579   m_ChipCount++;
00580 }
00581 
00582 /**
00583  * Get the genotype calls for a particular probeset.
00584  * @param name - name of probeset to get genotype calls for.
00585  * @return - A vector of the calls from dm algorithm.
00586  */
00587 std::vector<affx::GType> DmListener::getGenoCalls(const std::string &name)
00588 {
00589   if (!m_KeepGenotypes)
00590     Err::errAbort("Genotypes requested from DmListener bug flag to keep them was set to false!");
00591   std::map<std::string, std::vector<affx::GType> >::iterator mapIter;
00592   mapIter = m_KnownCalls.find(name);
00593   if (mapIter == m_KnownCalls.end()) {
00594     Err::errAbort("DmListener::getGenoCall() - Can't find genotypes for name: " + name);
00595   }
00596   return mapIter->second;
00597 }

00600  * Set the full name to use for the call rate metric reported
00601  * via the chip summary interface.
00602  * @param label - the full name to use for the call rate metric
00603  */
00604 void DmListener::setCallRateName(std::string label) {
00605   m_CallRateName = label;
00606 }
00607 
00608 /**
00609  * Set the prefix to use on chip summary metric labels. Defaults
00610  * to "dm-listener".
00611  * @param prefix - the prefix to use
00612  */
00613 void DmListener::setPrefix(std::string prefix) {
00614   m_Prefix = prefix;
00615   m_CallRateName = m_Prefix + "_call_rate";
00616 }

00618 /* Quick and dirty. */
00619 float DmListener::square(float x) {
00620   return x * x;
00621 }
